text:
Hi everyone, I wonder if anybody could help with an issue we are experiencing within the HubDB please. We have set up a new table and have a column with a 'Number' column type.

Within this column we are trying to enter '0' in selected rows but this value is not being accepted - it is just being cleared out. Any other value is saved without issues.

Is there a global setting that needs to be adjusted somewhere to resolve this?

Many thanks, Chris
I don’t think there is a setting. You could use a text field instead.
I think this is just a UI bug. If you export the data it looks like it is properly being stored as 0
Anyone else feel like using your current table id in a foreign id column is a little like: <https://media.giphy.com/media/26ufdipQqU2lhNA4g/giphy.gif>
never tried O_O not sure what I would use that for but seems useful
Using a table for dynamic pages.  Want to be able to have the option to link to other pages
Hey guys is there any other way to query filter a Foreign ID column other than by rowID ?
when using `&orderBy=` is there a way to order number values by lowest to highest?
it will already do this. you’re likely using a normal text field for this. if you use a number field or |int your text string it will convert to number and sort that way

Im using a date and time column type for the column, so its

`{% set query = "&orderBy=event_end_date_and_time" %}{% set table = hubdb_table_rows(XXX, 'query') %}`
